law.catch_line: If the Department is satisfied that a limited liability company named in the proclamation has not fa...

text.section: If the Department is satisfied that a limited liability company named in the proclamation has not failed to pay the tax, unemployment insurance contributions, or reimbursement payments, or file the report within the period specified in § 4A-911 of this subtitle, or that it has been mistakenly reported to the Department by the State Comptroller or the Secretary of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation, the Department may correct the mistake by filing its proclamation to that effect in its records.

The effect of a proclamation correcting a mistake is to restore the right to do business in Maryland and the right to the use of the name of the limited liability company as if the right to do business in Maryland and the right to the use of the name had at all times remained in full force and effect.
